meta.content: Welcome to Grygla Public School! At Grygla, we offer small town living, with convenient access to things that a larger city can offer. We are located between Roseau, Warroad and Thief River...

a.span: Special Education and Title I - Mrs. Severts
Special Education and Title I - Mrs. Severts

div.div:
Welcome to Grygla Public School! At Grygla, we offer small town living, with convenient access to things that a larger city can offer. We are located between Roseau, Warroad and Thief River Falls. Our school offers an outstanding 12 to 1 student to teacher ratio, while also being able to provide our students with top-notch teachers and greater technology access than many schools multiple times bigger. Our high academic expectations, along with a variety of extra-curricular activities have helped countless students find success in the world beyond our walls. I am proud to say that in Grygla, we truly are more like a family than a school. Please take a minute to consider the advantages that attending school in Grygla might offer your students. Click the "Attend our School" link below to find out more information about how to join our CHARGER FAMILY! If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to call me at 218-294-6155, or email me at jlunsetter@grygla.k12.mn.us. GO CHARGERS!
Sincerely,
Jamie Lunsetter, Superintendent
Derek Gieseke, Principal

div.font: Please let us know how we can improve our website. Click this LINK to submit your input!

At the Grygla School, we are actively seeking out and rewarding kindness among our students. Each week, students are asked to "fill their buckets" with instances when someone has been kind to them, or they have seen kindness happen. At the end of the week, winners are chosen, and t-shirts are awarded to those students. Weekly winners can be found in the Grygla Eagle.
BE CHARGER KIND!

li.span: Looking for people interested in substitute teaching who possess a four year degree in any field. Please call Jamie Lunsetter at 218-294-6155.
Looking for substitute bus drivers, cooks, and janitors. Contact Jamie Lunsetter at 218-294-6155.

strong.font: Do you know someone in crisis that needs help? There are many resources available to help. Please contact Jamie Lunsetter at the school (218-294-6155) or click this LINK for more information.

div.font: Our school funding increases as more families apply and are approved for free or reduced lunches. If you think you might qualify for free or reduced lunches, please apply for these benefits. If you have questions, please call Galen Clow at 218-294-6155. Click here for the application.

em.font: Please click on the video below to watch our video on lunchroom etiquette!

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

br.br:
CodeRED is an automated notification system Marshall County can use to call up to 60,000 phone numbers per hour with a recorded message. CodeRED can reach individuals by residential phone, business phone or cell phone. It will make three attempts to contact citizens and will leave messages in voicemail boxes and on answering machines. Emergency personnel can send a message to the entire county or to a selected area.
Click here for the PDF.
